intro: Cynanchum carautanum, commonly known as the Carautan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among milkweeds. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to dry environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive corolla that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
